project_descr: This Programme aims at contributing to the development of a democratic, decentralized, transparent and inclusive system of Local Governance in the oPt that is more responsive and capable of delivering quality services to local communities.

outputs.output_descr: Support to increasing own-source revenues in the Local Governance System in the occupied Palestinian territory
To support the definition and delegation of economic development responsibilities for the target local government unit/s and to provide direct funding of local economic actions.

This project is part of  the  UNDP/PAPP  Local Governance Support Programme (LGSP 2010-2013) that aims to contribute to the development of a democratic, decentralized, transparent, and inclusive local governance system in the occupied Palestinian territory .  In 2008, UNDP/PAPP in coordination with Ministry of Local Governance, Association of Palestinian Local Authorities, and selected Local Government Units (LGUs), namely municipalities, developed a local governance integrity index to assess municipalities' performance. This project aims at applying the LG integrity index on 134 municipalities, identify performance deficiencies,  develop capacities of Ministry of Local Governance and municipalities in applying the index, developing and  implementing reform action plans to improve municipalities' performance. More specifically, the project aims to induce an enabling environment for promoting transparency and accountability at the local level, based on the principles of accountability, transparency, and active community participation.
As part of the LGSP, the project will significantly contribute to other LGSP components by promoting transparency and accountability that is necessary to efficiently manage local revenues  and is expected to encourage the central government in decentralizing other assigned revenues for municipalities that are currently managed by the central government. Moreover, increased degree of transparency and accountability in municipalities will increase confidence between municipalities and their constituencies. 
This project is part of  the UNDP/PAPP  Local Governance Support Programme (LGSP 2010-2013) that aims to contribute to the development of a democratic, decentralized, transparent, and inclusive local governance system in the occupied Palestinian territory. In 2008, UNDP/PAPP jointly with Ministry of Local Governance, Association of Palestinian Local Authorities and selected Local Government Units (LGUs), namely municipalities, developed a local governance integrity index (Assessment Toolkit)  to assess municipalities' performance. This project aims at applying the LG integrity index on 134 municipalities, identify performance deficiencies,  develop capacities of Ministry of Local Governance and municipalities in applying the index, developing and  implementing reform action plans to improve municipalities' overall performance. More specifically, the project aims to induce an enabling environment for promoting transparency and accountability at the local level, based on the principles of accountability, transparency, and active community participation.
As part of the LGSP, the project will significantly contribute to other LGSP components by promoting transparency and accountability that is necessary to efficiently manage local revenues and is expected to encourage the central government in decentralizing other assigned revenues for municipalities that are currently managed by the central government. Moreover, increased degree of transparency and accountability in municipalities will increase confidence between municipalities,  their constituencies and donors. 
The project is planned to apply the integrity index tool on all 134 municipalities in the occupied Palestinian territory, identify strengths and weaknesses, develop and implement reform action plans for  at least 30 select municipalities which will be significantly reflected in improved performance of the target municipalities.

The Capacity Development project comes within the context of Local Governance Support Programme (LGSP 2010 - 2013) that aims to contribute to the development of a democratic, decentralized, transparent, and inclusive local governance system in the oPt, that is more responsive and capable of delivering quality services to local communities. In line with the 13th Government Programme of August 2009 "Ending the Occupation, Establishing the State", this project is designed to provide technical support to: a) enhance institutional development of MoLG through providing needed, field and office equipment and experts for better effectiveness and efficiency; b); develop the MoLG's staff individual capacities and c) Develop the MoLG capacity to institutionalize and document work procedures and manuals.
